s.text: Now I can't wait for the next production.
The director's beautiful detachment suggests a kind of cowardice.
D'Oyly Carte becomes a quiet third protagonist, a humane businessman.
I saw a D'Oyly Carte production of The Mikado in the late '70s: It was played fast and to the groundlings and made me never want to see a G&S opera again.
Furthermore, Leuchter can't figure out how the gas would even have been administered without killing the Nazis themselves--proof, he argues, that mass extermination at Auschwitz never took place.
